Posts.Title: New Challenge for you

Posts.Content: ahhh newbies...I remember when i didn't know what it was either.. The plus means that person is not your friend yet. You can request the person be your friend by clicking on the plus. You have a - because you can't be your own friend..
Posts.Title: What does the + sign mean next to all of your names?

Posts.Content: Poor thing!!! I would try the soaks... then gently pat dry.. then maybe lay down with just a sheet and no undies so air can heal it and so moisture won't stay in there...

Posts.Title: CALMNESS IN OUR LIVES OVER THE HOLIDAYS

Posts.Content: Was stage 2A, ER/PR+ Her 2 Neg, no lymph nodes, nucular grade 2. I had bi lateral w/ immediate reconstruction. My onco score was 10. I don't have to do chemo and I have chosen not to take tamoxifen. I know I am taking chances by my choice but I do have peace of mind of my choices and that is the end result. I trusted my gut. Calleen
Posts.Title: Finding someone with similar dx

Posts.Content: I agree with you Ritzy... Its been about a year since I posted and months since I looked in on this sight. BUT the Kindred Spirit is still very much alive here and the bond is unbreakable.... Calleen

Posts.Title: Do you want to know something sisters in pink?

Posts.Content: one time I wanted a dance-a-rina doll so badly (anyone remember those?) and when my Mom wrapped up our gifts I carefully untaped it and saw it was what I had wanted so badly!! I didn't feel bad that year.. BUT.. a few years later I begged and begged for a sewing machine.. I'm serious I wouldn't stop talking about it. I kept asking my Mom if that was what I was going to get.. She shut me up by saying "yes you are".. I never asked or peeked again!!!
Posts.Title: Another happy ornament recipient!

Posts.Content: I had both breasts done on July 29th. I have to go back to work in a few minutes but will be back about 4:30 central time.. just ask away and I'll do what I can to help you..
Posts.Title: Got New Breast from tummy

Posts.Content: I wish your Doctor lived here so I could go to him too!!! I had a bad experience with mine so now I'm looking for another... I won't take the flu shot. I hardly ever get sick. Other than this cancer I've always had a really good immune system.
Posts.Title: Got my Flu Shot today, did you get yours?

Posts.Content: I haven't had any kind of tummy problems. I know my tummy is now very very tight and sometimes I feel my intestines bubbling right at the surface of the skin. Have you had any x-rays or ultra sounds of your gut?? What kinds of tests have they done? Your right tha something is going on becsue you should not be having that kind of pain in your belly like that..
Posts.Title: Got New Breast from tummy

Posts.Content: are never easy are they?? If it was me making the choice I would go to the one that I felt the most comfortable & made me feel like I mattered to them. Doctors recomendations for treatments seem to vary depending on what they believe and what they have experienced with the Sisters before us. You are the one who is going to make those trips to the facility you choose. You will make the right choice!! It's weird when a final decision has come to me!! It just feels right!!! And I don't look back!! Let us know!!! Calleen
Posts.Title: 2 different opions..soo confused

Posts.Content: was a candidate for a lumpectomy.. but I chose to do a bi-lateral with immediate reconstruction using the tummy tissue. I also am happy with my choice. When my journey first started I had the thought of both.. but was so back and forth about it... I talked to my plastic surgeon and another trusted oncology nurse. They both listened to my arguments on doing both sides vs just one. (I knew I didn't want a lumpectomy).. this is what they said to me... My argument was I didn't want to take advantage of my situation and felt like I was being vain by doing both and coming out a bigger size... I would have never had augumentation.. So the oncology nurse said.. Listen I feel your leaning more toward both becasue of this and this.. So what you do is Make your decision STICK TO IT and LET IT GO!!! The plastic surgeon said "hey why not do both.. may as well get something out of having cancer..." I should say some of my fears were the worry of it coming back in the other breast and going through it all over again. and I didn't want to do radiation... I also thought about that I now have the insurance and what If I didn't have it in the future if it came back. I would have the same costs again and same surgery only would have to use implant.. plus using the tummy is a one shot deal... so tummy tuck + 2 bigger breasts = fabulous new body... well at least to me and that's all that counts!!! Me and my peace of mind!!! It is such a personal decision... and all of us on here have been where you are!!!
Posts.Title: Bi-lateral mastectomy

Posts.Content: still around. I haven't logged on this site in awhile. I'm so glad to read so many of you are doing well. and will be thinking of you with your upcoming appointments. So many of you were there for me last summer and I joined in the middle of the hedge hog thread and thought whoa what are these ladies talking about.. But I was warmly welcomed into this group and have been forever grateful for the friendships... As for me latley ...well I haven't been doing too good to be honest. I've feel into a deep depression and am having a hard time with so many areas of my life.. That is why I haven't been on here. I didn't feel like I could be a good support for our sisters. I usually just play farmville as an escape to keep my mind away from my life for the time being... This is not how I am and I hope that in the next few months I can get me back... Sorry to sound so down but I hope you guys will keep me in your thoughts and prayers... Ca;;een...

Posts.Title: Home from St. Louis... at last!

Posts.Content: For you guys!!! There's no place like home is there!!! I'm sharing my first chup of coffee with you guys this morning!!.. Hope you and your puppy family had a peaceful night's sleep.. Enjoy this Beautiful day!!! HUGZ... Calleen
Posts.Title: Home from St. Louis... at last!

Posts.Content: Haven't yet had chemo... if I do i will be refering to your thread.. I want to wish you well on this part of your Journey!!! HUGZ... Calleen
Posts.Title: Tips and tricks for chemo. - would appreciate

Posts.Content: It must be going around because you said just what I have been feeling too... I've been an emotional wreck the last few days and can't seem to shake it either... Maybe all us emotional gals should get together with a giant box of kleenex and some ice cream and just let it all out... I do hope you feel better soon!!! I hope you spend the next few days or however long it takes to be good to yourself!!! Have you been to a support group meeting yet??? My first one is tonight... I'm looking forward to sharing what happens with my Sisters... the Topic??? "What to do about well meaning friends" HUGZ... Calleen
Posts.Title: I'm having a hard time...

Posts.Content: How is your day going today??? I hope you got lots of good rest and did something special foryourself!!! I did notice that you posted some yesterday so I'm hoping that means you are feeling better!!! As you know my hormones were also not being nice to me either yesterday... Post and let us know how your are today... HUGZ...Calleen
Posts.Title: I'm having a hard time...

Posts.Content: That's just following the rules a bit too far!! come on!!! shouldn't you be under the high risk catagory anyway?? and be getting a mamo every 6 months!!! The mamo place can request that and so can your Doctors and the insurance must pay for it!!!
